article.text: 6:56am UK, Monday May 14, 2012 Jomsom is a popular area for trekkers near the Annapurna mountain range (photo: Vyacheslav Argenberg) 6:56am UK, Monday May 14, 2012 Police spokesman Binod Singh said the Agni Air plane crashed into a hill near Jomsom, a popular area for trekkers near the Annapurna mountain range. "Seven men and four women have been killed," he said. Mr Singh said there were six survivors, including two children, who had been rescued. "The plane was about to land at Jomsom Airport. It hit a muddy slope and the plane is now buried in the side of the hill," he said. Mr Singh said the aircraft had been carrying 18 passengers and three crew members. Of those on board the plane, sixteen passengers were Indian and two Westerners, police official Nareswor Aryal said. He could not immediately say where those two are from. Jomsom Airport is a gateway to a popular trekking destination, about 200 kilometres (125 miles) north west of the capital, Kathmandu. The weather servers are currently busy, please try again in a couple of minutes. Manchester City boss Roberto Mancini admitted it was 'incredible' to win the title after their dramatic 3-2 victory over QPR. Pastor Maldonado has claimed victory in Spain, rebuffing home favourite Fernando Alonso to secure Williams' first victory since 2004. Manchester City snatched victory from the jaws of defeat to be crowned champions for the first time in 44 years on a day of incredible drama. Copyright ©2012 BskyB
